result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas L Ball was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. Bond on hand will be applied towards fine/costs.
AODA and comply with any treatment recommended. Submit DNA sample.

9:00 AM Defendant Thomas L Ball in court, in custody with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements. Defendant pled guilty to Ct. 1. Court found guilty. Judgment was entered. Cts. 2-4 dismissed but read in. Sentencing arguments heard. Statements made by R.F. and C.B. on behalf of defendant. Defendant made a statement to the Court. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 85 months, in prison, concurrent to any other cases, 25 months initial confinement and 60 months extended supervision. Conditions of extended supervision include: $518.00 costs. Submit DNA sample. AODA and comply with any treatment recommended. Bond on hand will be used towards costs, remaining balance will be returned to poster. Defendant is eligible for challenge incarceration program and the substance abuse program. 3 days jail credit. 9:21 AM
